tit.e: The Mother of MINAMOTO no Kaneyoshi
The Mother of MINAMOTO no Kanetoshi

sen.j: 源兼俊母（みなもと の かねとし の はは、生没年不詳）は、平安時代後期の歌人。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Kaneyoshi's mother (date of birth and death unknown) was kajin (waka poet) who lived toward the end of the Heian period.
The mother of MINAMOTO no Kaneyoshi (year of birth and death unknown) was a kajin (waka poet) who lived toward the end of the Heian period.
The mother of MINAMOTO no Kanetoshi (year of birth and death unknown) was a kajin (waka poet) who lived toward the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 筑前国守高階成順の娘。
sen.e: She was a daughter of TAKASHINA no Narinobu, who held the title of Chikuzen no kuni no kami (Governor of Chikuzen Province).
She was a daughter of TAKASHINA no Narinobu, who held the title of Chikuzen no kuni no kami (Governor of Chikuzen Province).
She was a daughter of TAKASHINA no Narinobu, who held the title of Chikuzen no kuni no kami (Governor of Chikuzen Province).
Her mother was Ise no Taifu.
Her mother was Ise no Taifu.
Her mother was Ise no Taifu.

sen.j: 姉妹に康資王母・筑前乳母らがいた。
sen.e: Her siblings included Yasusukeo no haha (mother of Prince Yasusuke) and Chikuzen no menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby).
Her siblings included Yasusukeo no haha (mother of Prince Yasusuke) and Chikuzen no menoto (a wet nurse of baby of noble birth).
Her siblings included Yasusukeo no haha (mother of Prince Yasusuke) and Chikuzen no menoto (a woman providing breast-feed to a highborn baby).

sen.j: 宇多源氏の源経宗の室となり、笙・和琴の名手源兼俊を産んだ。
sen.e: She became a wife of MINAMOTO no Tsunemune定訳不明, who was from Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan), and gave birth to MINAMOTO no Kaneyoshi, who was a master of Sho (Japanese flute) and wagon (Japanese harp).

She became a wife of MINAMOTO no Tsunemune, who was from the Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan), and gave birth to MINAMOTO no Kaneyoshi, who was a master of both sho (Japanese flute) and wagon (Japanese harp).

She became a wife of MINAMOTO no Tsunemune, who was from the Uda-Genji (Minamoto clan), and gave birth to MINAMOTO no Kanetoshi, who was a master of both sho (Japanese flute) and wagon (Japanese harp).

sen.j: 彼女自身も『後拾遺和歌集』に2首入集する歌人だった。
sen.e: She was kajin and two of her poems were selected for "Goshui Wakashu" (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry).
She was a kajin and two of her poems were selected for the "Goshui Wakashu" (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry).
She was a kajin and two of her poems were selected for "the Goshui Wakashu" (Later Collection of Gleanings of Japanese Poetry).
